entry.dcterms:title: TÁRKI Omnibus 2003/2. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.
entry.dcterms:creator: Nagy, Ildikó
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-F63: TÁRKI Omnibus 2003/2. Social-political attitudes in Hungary among the adult population.. data sheet. Version: 2007-01-19
entry.dcterms:creator: 1. Gazsó, Tibor
2. Tóth, István György
3. Lengyel, György
4. Rudas, Tamás
5. Bartók, Béla
entry.dcterms:contributor: Budapest University of Economic Sciences and Public Administration (3.)
entry.dcterms:description: 1) party preferences, popularity of politicians, evaluation of the work of the government and opposition, subjective financial situation, evaluating the economic situation of Hungary 2) opinions about the EU accession 3) the effect of the EU accession on the Hungarian economy, knowledge and opinion about the NATO membership; enterpreneurs, opinions plans, strategies of changing jobs; migration and emigration plans; life style characteristics, questions about healt and satisfaction; willingnes to participate in strikes and demonstrations; opinions about the information society, internet and computer use 4) examination of inflations expectations of the population 5) car demand and supply, attitude surveys regarding driving a car
entry.dcterms:subject: consumption/consumer behavior
censuses
information society
time use
business/industrial management and organisation
social and occupational mobility
economic policy
income, property and savings
social behaviour and attitudes
housing
labour and employment

migration

religion and values
health condition
cultural and national identity
political institutions, public administration
person
survey data
cross-section

A multi-stage proportionally stratified random probability sample representative of the Hungarian adult population. Unsuccessful inquiries were substituted with supplementary addresses, where persons to be interviewed were selected on the basis of the Leslie Kish key.
face-to-face interview
block 1: A, block 2: A, block 3: A, block 4: C, block 5: D
